intro: Cyrtandra axillantha, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it grows as a shrub or small tree. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in coastal and lowland forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and is often protected in conservation efforts.
